div.p: The Highland Park Senior Center is located on N. Figueroa St. and York Blvd, offering a space for older residents of Highland Park to participate in organized activities and events in the community center. This is also the meeting location of the Highland Park Neighborhood Council, which focuses on community concerns and special events held within Highland Park. The Neighborhood Council consists of community volunteers and others, who are stakeholders in the community, and seeks to engage community members in the development of the neighborhood. The council board members are also viewed as a bridge to elected officials, who represents the community and has control over policies that pertain to Highland Park’s political, economic and social development. The council offers a platform for democracy amongst Latinos and other residents to fully participate in community issues and allow community members to voice opinions on various interests the neighborhood council has prioritized.

note.p: The Highland Park Senior Center offers Highland Park’s Neighborhood Council a space to engage residents in community issues and development.

listBibl.bibl: Fulton, William. "Chapter Three: Suburbs of Extraction." The Reluctant Metropolis: The Politics of Urban Growth in Los Angeles. Solano, 1997. Print.
